The '''Friendly Update''' is the name of the update for ''[[Pocket Edition]]'', ''[[Windows 10 Edition]]'', and ''[[Gear VR Edition]]'' as [[Pocket Edition v0.15.0 alpha|alpha version v0.15.0]]. It released on June 10, 2016 for Android and June 13, 2016 across all other platforms.

The official name for the update, the ''Friendly Update'', was revealed on June 3, 2016 in a blog post on the Mojang website.<ref>https://web.archive.org/web/20160603130421/http://www.mojang.com/2016/06/whats-in-015-the-friendly-update-for-pocket-win-10/</ref>

== Notable features ==
{{main|Pocket Edition v0.15.0 alpha}}
; New [[block]]s
* [[File:Observer BE1.png|32px]] [[Observer]]
** Crafted using six [[cobblestone]], two [[redstone dust]]s, and a [[nether quartz]].
** Used to give a redstone signal when it detects a block update.
* [[File:Piston (U) JE2 BE1.png|32px]] [[Piston]] & [[File:Sticky Piston (U) JE2 BE1.png|32px]] [[Sticky Piston]]
** Pistons are crafted using four [[cobblestone]]s, three [[plank|wood planks]], an [[iron ingot]], and a [[redstone dust]].
** Sticky pistons are crafted using a [[slimeball]] and a piston.
** Both can be used to push or pull blocks.
*** This includes block entities like [[chest]]s.

; New [[item]]s
* [[File:Carrot on a Stick JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Carrot on a Stick]]
** Crafted using a [[fishing rod]] and a [[carrot]].
** Used to control the movement of [[pig]]s when riding them with a [[saddle]].
* [[File:Fire Charge JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Fire Charge]]
** Crafted using a [[blaze powder]], a [[coal]] or [[charcoal]], and a [[gunpowder]].
** Lights things on fire when used.
** When ejected from a [[dispenser]], it fires the projectile out.
* {{Animate|Leather Horse Armor (item) BE1.png;Iron Horse Armor (item) JE1 BE1.png;Golden Horse Armor (item) JE1 BE1.png;Diamond Horse Armor (item) JE1 BE1.png|32px}} [[Horse Armor]]
** Comes in leather, iron, gold, and diamond.
*** Leather horse armor can be crafted using seven leather in an H shape.
*** The other horse armors can be found in [[monster room|dungeon]]s, [[nether fortress]]es, [[desert pyramid|desert temple]]s, and [[jungle pyramid|jungle temple]]s.
** Used to give protection to [[horse]]s.
** Leather horse armor can be dyed in numerous colors.
** Cannot be used on [[donkey]]s, [[mule]]s, or [[skeleton horse]]s.
* [[File:Lead JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Lead]]
** Crafted using four [[string]] and a [[slimeball]].
** Used to leash mobs around.
** Can be attached to a [[fence]].
* [[File:Name Tag JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Name Tag]]
** Found in [[monster room|dungeon]]s.
** Used to rename mobs by renaming the item with an [[anvil]] and then using it on a mob.
** Named mobs do not despawn.
* [[File:Raw Mutton JE2 BE1.png|32px]] [[Raw Mutton]] and its [[File:Cooked Mutton JE2 BE1.png|32px]] [[Cooked Mutton|cooked variant]]
** Obtained as drops from [[sheep]].
** Raw mutton restores {{hunger|2}} hunger and gives 1.2 hunger saturation.
** Cooked mutton restores {{hunger|6}} hunger and gives 9.6 hunger saturation.
* {{Animate|Arrow of Fire Resistance JE1 BE1.png; Arrow of Harming JE1 BE1.png; Arrow of Healing JE1 BE1.png; Arrow of Invisibility JE1 BE1.png; Arrow of Leaping JE1 BE1.png; Arrow of Night Vision JE1 BE1.png; Arrow of Poison JE1 BE1.png; Arrow of Regeneration JE1 BE1.png; Arrow of Slowness JE1 BE1.png; Arrow of Strength JE1 BE1.png; Arrow of Swiftness JE1 BE1.png; Arrow of Water Breathing JE1 BE1.png; Arrow of Weakness JE1 BE1.png|32px}} [[Tipped Arrow]]
** Obtained by using an arrow on a cauldron filled with a corresponding potion effect.
** When fired at an entity, it inflicts the corresponding status effect.
* [[Spawn egg]]s:
** [[File:Donkey Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] Donkey Spawn Egg
** [[File:Horse Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] Horse Spawn Egg
** [[File:Husk Spawn Egg BE1.png|32px]] Husk Spawn Egg
** [[File:Mule Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] Mule Spawn Egg
** [[File:Skeleton Horse Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] Skeleton Horse Spawn Egg
** [[File:Stray Spawn Egg BE1.png|32px]] Stray Spawn Egg
** [[File:Wither Skeleton Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] Wither Skeleton Spawn Egg
** [[File:Zombie Horse Spawn Egg BE1.png|32px]] Zombie Horse Spawn Egg

; New [[mob]]s
* {{Animate|Black Horse Revision 1.gif;Brown Horse Revision 1.gif;Chestnut Horse Revision 1.gif;Creamy Horse Revision 1.gif;Darkbrown Horse Revision 1.gif;Gray Horse Revision 1.gif;White Horse Revision 1.gif|32px}} [[Horse]]s
** Rideable mobs found in [[plain]]s in small groups.
** Has to be tamed by repeatedly riding the horse, subsequently getting thrown off, until the horse shows heart particles.
*** Can be tamed easier by feeding the horse [[bread]], [[sugar]], [[hay bale]]s, [[wheat]], [[apple]]s, [[golden apple]]s, or [[golden carrot]]s.
** Upon taming, a [[saddle]] is required to ride the horse.
*** Players can also put on [[horse armor]] for protection.
** Stats (health, speed, and jump height) and color vary between horses.
** Can be bred using [[golden apple]]s or [[golden carrot]]s.
** Drops [[leather]] when killed.
* [[File:Donkey JE1.png|32px]] [[Donkey]]
** Rideable mobs found in [[plain]]s in small groups.
** Has similar functionality to the horse, but has the ability to put on a [[chest]] for storage access.
** Can be bred using [[golden apple]]s or [[golden carrot]]s.
** Drops [[leather]] when killed.
* [[File:Mule JE1.png|32px]] [[Mule]]
** Spawns upon the breeding of a horse and a donkey.
** Has similar functionality to the donkey.
** Cannot breed with any other horses, donkeys, and mules.
** Drops [[leather]] when killed.
* [[File:Skeleton Horse Revision 1.png|32px]] [[Skeleton Horse]]
** An [[undead]] variant of the [[horse]] that spawns in as a skeleton horse trap.
*** When closely approached, it splits into three other skeleton horses with a helmet-wielding skeleton riding them.
** Are always tamed upon being spawned.
** Cannot bred to produce baby offsprings.
** Drops [[bone]]s when killed.
* [[File:Zombie Horse Revision 1.png|32px]] [[Zombie Horse]]
** Only available through spawn eggs.
** Is considered an [[undead]] mob.
** Cannot be bred to produce baby offsprings.
** Drops [[rotten flesh]] when killed.
* [[File:Husk JE2 BE2.png|32px]] [[Husk]]
** Spawns in [[desert]] biomes.
** Behaves similarly to a zombie but inflicts [[Hunger (effect)|Hunger]] to attacked players.
* [[File:Stray JE2 BE4.png|32px]] [[Stray]]
** Spawns in [[ice plains]], [[ice mountains]], and [[ice plains spikes]].
** Behaves similarly to a skeleton but shoots [[tipped arrow]]s of [[Slowness]] instead.

; New [[Generated structures|structures]]
* [[File:Jungle pyramid JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Jungle Pyramid|Jungle temple]]
** An aboveground structure found in [[jungle]] biomes.
** Has various [[tripwire]] traps safeguarding loot.
** Also has a puzzle involving [[piston]]s that provide access to a room with a chest containing loot.
* New village types:
** [[Taiga]] villages, [[cold taiga]] villages, & [[ice plains]] villages
*** Uses [[spruce]] wood instead of [[oak]].
** Zombie villages
*** Spawns rarely with [[mossy cobblestone|moss stone]] and [[cobweb]]s
*** Its only inhabitants are [[zombie villager]]s.

; Other additions
* [[Realms]]
** A subscription-based service allowing players to host a server with help by [[Mojang]]
** Requires logging into an Xbox Live account.
* Online multiplayer via Xbox Live.

; Notable changes
* [[Pig]]s can now be ridden with a saddle and controlled using a [[carrot on a stick]].
* Villages in [[savanna]] biomes now use acacia wood.
* [[Trapdoor]]s no longer require supporting blocks.
* [[Shear]]s now lose durability when breaking any block.
* For performance, online multiplayer now uses less bandwidth.
